sense.name: give a command to someone
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1[agent[human]] ORDER NP2[patient[animate]] [predicate] where NP1 has some authority over NP2
sense.examples: She ordered him to do the shopping. He had been ordered to appear at Korumburra Magistrates Court. Ferretti ordered her to continue taking her medication while in jail. Then he appointed a commander for each division and ordered them to surround the city. The victim says that the owner ordered the dogs to attack.

sense.name: request something to be made, supplied, or delivered
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1[agent[human]] ORDER NP2 Note: may also follow syntactic frame of sense 1, as in "massage therapist" example below-- but this is obviously a request for a service, not a command!
sense.examples: Germania, a charter airline, ordered three 737-300s, doubling its fleet. I just ordered pizza from panhandle pizza. You can order flowers online 24 hours a day. And I have ordered a massage therapist to give you a special rub down with sun screen.

sense.name: organize
sense.examples: I then realized that I'd ordered the files incorrectly in my guesses. I ordered the papers before the meeting, but forgot to bring them. This version has re-ordered the guidelines in a more logical way. We have conceptualized and ordered the world in a certain way.

sense.name: appoint to clerical posts
sense.commentary: meaning "ordain, consecrate, ordinate" as in belonging to a religious order
